answers.answer: What you have described does sound like it could be the beginnings of early labor.  Keep a check on your contractions.  If they become regular and closer together, call your ob and see when s/he wants you to go in. Of course, if your water breaks, don't bother calling, just go in.

My contractions just come and go tho nothing really regular to where i could time them. I have been feeling so uncomfortable and not good at all i feel dizzy and shaky some times i really just wish they would go on and induce me already, i dont know how much more of this i can take.

Hey you might want to call your doctor and let them know how you are feeling. Feeling sick and dizzy isn't a good thing and could indicate an infection that you might need some antibiotics for. It does sound like you don't have very long to go! Lots of sticky labor dust for you!
I agree with nickie, you didn't mention the dizzy feelings in your OP, it's probably best to go ahead and call.

I had called them once before for feeling like this because i didnt like the way i feeled and all they said was lay on your left side and drink plenty of water. Its not a constant feeling of being dizzy it just comes and goes as well and sometimes i get so dizzy that i feel like im gonna faint and get blury vision, But it dont last long. Im due on the 16th of June and i dont think i can last til then im way to uncomfortable and dont like the way i feel sometimes not to mention i also have depression and its not helping at all. I wish they would just induce me today. I mean is there anyway that i can get them to? Im already dilated to a 1 and i am 36 weeks and 3 days.
Blurred vision is something that needs to be reported to your doctor asap as it can be a sign of something Serious. i recommend you call your doctor asap.
Unless there's a medical reason I don't think they will. Most seem to induce at 38-40 weeks.

a lot of what you have described are symptoms for pre-eclampsia.  While it may not be that, you need to be seen and evaluated.  The headaches, swelling, dizziness and blurred vision are some warning signs.  If your doc won't get you an appt to be seen, then, if *I* were in your shoes, I would go to L & D and let them know exactly what's going on.  It's better safe than sorry.

Well early labor can last for days. And I agree with LosingMyMindinGA's last comment. Definitely get checked out!As far as labor goes; it is absolutely unpredictable. Even if you think you could be going you could still be pregnant a week later. The only surefire way to know you're in labor is if your water breaks, if you're contracting consistently and strongly or if you're 100% effaced and over 5cm dilated.

Once i read all of yalls comments i looked up the symptoms of pre-eclampsia now im very nervous. Cause i never knew the symptoms of pre-elampsia but i have many of them that i never knew were signs. I have~Very bad lower back pains(to where sometimes i can barley even walk)*Very bad headaches(to where they make me sick to my stomach)*My hands get swollen when i walk to long*Troubles catching my breath sometimes.*Blury vision(when i get dizzy and lightheaded)*I weighed 105 lbs before i got pregnant and now weigh 154 and i gained 12 lbs in 2 weeks.*I pee it seems like every 10 to 15 minutes(but sometimes dont even pee much, just the urge to pee).*My blood pressure has been low not high* Im very worried now. I got NO sleep last night i just kept getting the urge to get up and couldnt get comfortable i can imagine how much sleep i wont get tonight now im gonna be up all night worried to death!

I would again suggest you contact your doctor. You can do so today. I know its different at different places but my clinic allows me to call them and speak with a nurse whatEver day or time of day. Maybe you should try that. If nothing else, it should help put your mind at ease getting medical advice. I hope you get that baby out soon so You can feel better!!

Another thing that could be the culprit is a UTI the urge to urinate and not actually urinating or going frequently may be something as simple as pressure from the baby but it could also be an infection that requires anti biotics.

That does sound a lot like pre-eclampsia, though I would have thought they would have caught it when you were in last. That's what they usually check for when they do the urine test.If thats what it turns out to be, then you may just get your wish. They usually induce early because thats the safest for mother and child (its the only cure)

The actual cause of it isn't really known. There's a lot of theories of why, such as poor diet and nutrition, insufficient blood flow to the uterus,  obesity and weight, vitamin deficiency, etc. It's more common in first time pregnancy's and the rate drops in second time pregnancy's unless you've had it in the past.

question: Omg I walked for 4 hours today, took a hot bath and had sex but now I can't sleep! I'm having lots of pelvic pressure and feel like I have to use the restroom, but I cant. And I'm peeing like every 10 minutes it seems! And my daughter isn't moving as much as she usually does, but still moving! At my last visit i was dilated to a 1 which was this past monday. Ive been having some contractions, bad headaches and just not feeling well at all......Could labor be close?
title: Labor???????
